channel.title: A good PI client
channel.description:
hi guys. i'm still working on my 317 PI server , you can see the development thread [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,452526.0.html]here[/url].
anyways , it became appearent to me that the client is one of the oldest around... by that i mean , no gwd , barbabrian assault or anything...
so that's why i made this thread ; i was wondering if you guys know any good clients ( 508+ ) that are compatible with PI server's... i AM looking for a good client myself , i am just wondering if you guys know any good ones ( so i don't have to waste my time d - load one that doesnt work or isnt good )
so all you have to do is leave a link below with the client's protocol ( 508 , 525 , 562 , etc... ) and what you think of it. if the client isn't compatible with PI bases , then don't post it.
hope to get a good client soon , thx guys

item.title: A good PI client
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

hi guys.
i’m still working on my 317 PI server , you can see the development thread here.

anyways , it became appearent to me that the client is one of the oldest around…
by that i mean , no gwd , barbabrian assault or anything…

so that’s why i made this thread ;
i was wondering if you guys know any good clients ( 508+ ) that are compatible with PI server’s…
i AM looking for a good client myself , i am just wondering if you guys know any good ones ( so i don’t have to waste my time d - load one that doesnt work or isnt good )

so all you have to do is leave a link below with the client’s protocol ( 508 , 525 , 562 , etc… )
and what you think of it.
if the client isn’t compatible with PI bases , then don’t post it.

hope to get a good client soon , thx guys
